text: the endless expanse of space long
thought to be home to nothing but stars
planets maybe a few comments asteroids
and meteorites and vast areas containing
nothing at all but today that's all
changed new discoveries have revealed a
mysterious universe full of oddities and
strange formations almost beyond our
ability to comprehend
welcome to space school the more
astronomers study our universe the more
baffling the phenomena they uncover
black holes with gravity so strong even
light cannot escape dark matter and dark
energy something we can't see yet a
substance thought to make up much of the
universe even wormholes passageways not
through just space but time itself all
of these discoveries and theories have
shattered our understanding of what lies
beyond our own planet Earth and have
challenged many concepts that we take
for granted the idea of a black hole a
body so massive and so dense that
nothing can escape dates back to the
18th century but it wasn't until Albert
Einstein's theory of relativity
that anyone figured out how they could
happen a cosmic sinkhole forms when a
massive star at least 10 to 15 times
larger than Sun dies then collapses the
dying stars own gravity pulls its mass
inward to its core the result is matter
so dense that the gravitational field it
creates is unfathomably strong the edge
of a black hole is called the event
horizon anything that travels beyond
this point is doomed trapped unable to
escape in fact scientists believe that
black holes are so powerful that they
can bend time itself our Sun could never
become a black hole it is too small and
doesn't have enough gravity
it is theorized that most galaxies have
at their center a black hole but that's
hard to prove and what you're looking
for is invisible scientists have studied
black holes for decades yet everything
we know about the Miss Tia reticle and
since not even light escapes their
powerful grip will most likely never
know exactly what's inside these
mysterious formations but just because
we can't see them doesn't mean we can
ignore them a wayward black hole moving
through space could pass by and swallow
up our entire solar system us included
luckily astronomers have calculated the
chance of such a catastrophe happening
it's infinitesimally small quasars are
another Space Oddity and unlike black
holes they are incredibly bright in fact
quasars are the most luminous objects in
the known universe emitting the light of
one trillion Suns discovered in the late
1950s using radio telescopes scientists
believe that these gigantic formations
consist of a halo of matter surrounding
a supermassive black hole observing a
quasar may literally be witnessing the
birth of a galaxy more than a hundred
thousand quasars are known to exist most
billions of light-years away and all
quasars are so bright that they drown
out the light of the stars in their own
galaxy to maintain this incredible
luminosity quasars turn unimaginable
amounts of matter into energy the
largest known quasar is estimated to
consume matter equivalent to 600 earths
every hour
some of the strangest and most
controversial space phenomena are
wormholes a wormhole is a theoretical
tunnel through time and space a shortcut
connecting to different parts of the
universe or even to different time
periods could it be possible for humans
to enter a wormhole and emerge unscathed
on the other side of the universe or
maybe even in a parallel universe and
might you arrive at a time earlier than
when you left some scientists say yes
but others think that's just pure
science fiction unfortunately this is
one mystery we're not about to solve
anytime soon some scientists theorize
that wormholes could be manufactured for
human travel one less controversial but
no less mysterious component of the
universe is called dark matter thought
to comprise almost 23% of all matter we
can't even see dark matter or be sure of
its composition it's an unknown
substance that emits no light but has a
force of gravity strong enough to hold
together clusters of galaxies and it's
this gravitational pole that scientists
have been able to detect as galaxies
move through space enormous amounts of
heat are generated this combination of
speed and temperature should cause them
to break apart but they don't physicists
believe Dark Matters gravity keeps
galaxies together like some sort of
cosmic glue but this too is only a
theory as astronomers and physicists
learn more and more about our universe
their research seems to raise as many
questions as answers but understanding
the strange phenomena may one day lead
to humanity's exploration and even
settlement of worlds well beyond our own
and usher in an era in human history
like never before
this is space school signing off class
dismissed
